Job Title: Maintenance Technician

Location: University Park, IL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Manufacturing, Production

Description:
At Caldic we are continually developing our capabilities and we strive to become better every day, with the goal to build long-term relationships. To add value to our company, and to our inspiring solutions we are currently looking to add to our team. Are you a natural leader with a proven track record in the industrial market? Do you have the drive to succeed in a moving fast forward company? Then we are looking for you!
Position function: Reporting to the Maintenance Team Lead, the individual will be responsible to manage Caldic’s maintenance for the University Park facility.
Scope: The position will be responsible to oversee and complete the maintenance and servicing of the facility and equipment at the University Park facility. The individual will also be responsible to coordinate and schedule external contractors to complete onsite service as required. This position will work with production (dry and liquid blends), shipping and tote repair.
Major tasks and duties:Complete the contractor compliance and scheduled mechanical maintenance and repairs on all facility equipment as requiredResponsible to perform daily equipment and site inspections as requiredResponsible to work with operations teams to troubleshoot and resolve equipment malfunctions or breakdownsProvide operational guidance and recommendations to ensure equipment operates smoothly to minimize equipment breakdownsSource external vendors to provide various products, tools and materials for Caldic operations; Request quotes, present to the operations manager, request approval to create a purchase order and place orderResponsible to be a main contact to schedule and have contractors complete required maintenance and serviceEscort contractors to specific areas to service equipment within the Mississauga facility; ensure proper lock out/tag out procedures are followed prior to any serviceSupport maintenance and tote repair with any troubleshooting as it relates to the maintenance of the Caldic facility and equipmentDelegate various maintenance duties to department to ensure service and repairs are completed in a timely mannerTo attend any required training necessary for the job.Complete all other duties as assigned by the Maintenance Team LeadComply with Caldic’s policies on hygiene, safety and quality.Review the specific SDS for all controlled products; use the correct Personal Protective Equipment, how to handle the product, know where to find the information for each controlled productEnsure compliance with all health and safety regulations, GMP’s and HACCP requirementsResponsible for following Food Safety and Quality requirements as per Prerequisite programs, HACCP plans, CCP monitoring and SQF code.
Knowledge/Skills & Experience:Minimum grade 12 education or equivalentMust have a minimum of 5 years maintenance experience in a food manufacturing settingMust have a millwright license or demonstrated experience and certificationsMust be able to lift up to 25kg/50lbs on a regular basisMust be able to stand for long periods of timeWilling to work in a dusty and noisy work environment at all timesForklift, Reach Truck & Scissor Lift certification is requiredBoiler Experience is required

Experience Level (if available): Associate

output_json.title: Maintenance Technician
output_json.summary: Caldic is seeking a Maintenance Technician for their University Park facility.

Oversee and complete maintenance and servicing of facility and equipment.

Work with production teams to troubleshoot equipment issues.
Source external vendors for products, tools, and materials.
Schedule and escort contractors for maintenance services.
Support maintenance and tote repair with troubleshooting.
Comply with Caldic’s policies on hygiene, safety, and quality.
Review SDS for controlled products, use appropriate PPE.
Ensure compliance with health and safety regulations, GMPs, and HACCP requirements.
Follow Food Safety and Quality requirements as per Prerequisite programs, HACCP plans, CCP monitoring, and SQF code.
